title: @Meddler I'd like to remind you about one thing you responded to, but never followed up on it.

embed.description: And I mean very tiny, like 5 units. Currently if you try to do a max range Dark Sphere into Scatter the Weak the sphere won't be moved simply because the Scatter the Weak's range is by the skin of teeth too low.

body:
In the light of stuff being done to Syndra on PBE and recent Lux's Lucent Singularity change (which mechanically being similar, but practically very minor) I'd like to remind you of an issue you've seemingly forgot about.

With the courtesy of Wildnil here's a video of the issue.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AOG9kBTu1XU

Basically Q and E ranges match so perfectly that casting Dark Sphere while moving sideways(which is like 99% of Q casts in the lane) makes Scatter the Weak not knockback a sphere completely.

---

PS. Is it set in stone that current changes to Syndra won't be shipped next patch?

Best regards.

replies.body:
Regarding the Q+E combo I did a bit of digging into that the other day. E has a range of 700, with a bonus 100 for purposes of Dark Sphere collisions. Casting one immediately after the other should always knock the sphere back as a result, moving back slightly however (as per the above video) will cause the combo to fail.

Syndra changes won't be in 5.17, basically just due to lack of time, lot of stuff to work on in the patch. Looking at whether we can do some work on her in 5.18 instead, though that's not certain yet.

Hey Meddler. I'm the creator of the video in question. I do agree that the skill is currently working as intended (I said as much [when I initially posted it](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/7kUZ6pBf-meddler-repertoir-can-we-give-syndra-a-very-tiny-buff-to-the-scatter-the-weaks-range?comment=00010006), and repeated/added to those thoughts in [another comment in this thread](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/cWKqq7Le-meddler-id-like-to-remind-you-about-one-thing-you-responded-to-but-never-followed-up-on-it?comment=0001000000000001) ).

I would like to touch on Syndra's current balance state. I feel that the buffs currently on PBE are going in the wrong direction, and will be bad for the health of the game. While I love Syndra, seeing her buffed then immediately nerfed again will be heartbreaking.

**The short version:**
Syndra has always functioned as a jack of all trades, master of none (similar to Jarvan, Lee Sin, etc). She has more damage than utility mages, and more utility than damage mages, but is less effective than either at their respective specialties. If you want good utility, you grab someone like Orianna. If you want good damage, you pick Cassiopeia. If you want something inbetween, you pick Syndra.

Currently, she has arguably the single-worst laning phase in the game. Going by the buffs on PBE, it would appear that Riot is planning to buff her late-game damage to compensate, instead of fixing her early game directly. If we're going to buff her damage enough to justify such a terrible laning phase, **this is going to invalidate champions like Cassiopeia and Karthus.** Why pick any damage-focused mage when you can get the same damage numbers AND utility by picking Syndra?

I'm incredibly Syndra biased would have no issue with it, but I'm not completely blind. That would be bad for the game, and it would get her re-nerfed and we'd be back to where we are now.

**The long version:**
Read this comment  on reign of gaming and all its replies. There's really nothing more I can add to it.

Hi there. I'm the one who recorded that video. The reason you're being downvoted by people probably isn't because you're wrong (you're not), but because you feel the need to immediately cuss and swear about it.

Yes, in the video, I'm forced to move slightly backwards. First off, I'm human and can get a true 90* angle. Doing so was also not the point of the video, either. The purpose was to show just how unforgiving the skill is. After playing with it some, this was the smallest distance I could move with it showing up clientside (at least on the computer/connection I had been on at the time of recording, YMMV).

My general feeling is that the skill is working as intended, but a QoL buff wouldn't be entirely out of place either. I would much rather see mana buffs.

The is based off gut feeling and memory, not concrete evidence so take it with a grain of salt:
The skill used to be more forgiving, prior to the E nerfs. The change in size of orb hitbox also seems to have affected the launch hitbox as well - in otherwords the skill has effective range than it used to, since the E needs to hit the orb more directly.
